senses.de: Forward or onward movement towards a destination
senses.ex: We are making progress towards finishing the project

Tips.title: Physical Journey
Tips.description: Used to express advancement towards a specific place or in a procedure.
Tips.example: As we progress through the jungle, we hope to reach the village by nightfall.

Tips.title: Measure of Success
Tips.description: Often linked with achievements, suggesting positive movement or improvement.
Tips.example: Your progress in English has been remarkable since last semester.

Tips.title: Objective Evaluation
Tips.description: Can be used in contexts where advancement is monitored against set goals.
Tips.example: During the progress meeting, the team reviewed the project's milestones.

senses.de: Development towards an improved or more advanced condition
senses.ex: The progress of technology over the years has been astounding

Tips.title: Positive Change
Tips.description: Implies improvement or innovation in a broader, often non-physical, scope.
Tips.example: The city has seen considerable social progress in terms of equality.

Tips.title: Gradual Improvement
Tips.description: Refers to continuous improvement over time, not necessarily a quick process.
Tips.example: Steady economic progress has resulted in a higher standard of living.

Tips.title: Beyond Physical
Tips.description: Related to advancements in abstract areas like knowledge, rights, or civilization.
Tips.example: Technological progress has altered the way we communicate.

senses.de: Move forward in space or time
senses.ex: As the week progressed, the weather got worse

Tips.title: Time Element
Tips.description: Emphasizes movement through time, not just physical space.
Tips.example: The event progressed from afternoon into late evening with much festivity.

senses.de: Develop towards an improved or more advanced condition

Tips.title: Work Enhancements
Tips.description: Used to describe improvements in a project, skillset, or personal ability.
Tips.example: She is progressing well in her piano lessons.

senses.de: A state visit or official tour
senses.ex: The royal progress through the city was grand

Tips.title: Formal Events
Tips.description: Historical usage describing official ceremonies or dignified events.
Tips.example: The monarch's progress to the cathedral was lined with cheering citizens.

Advance.wordDefinition:
Advance means to move forward from one point to another by making improvements or gaining ground. It often implies a specific achievement or accomplishment.

For example, a student can advance to the next level after passing an exam or a technology can advance after a new upgrade.

Advance describes a specific achievement or improvement, while progress describes a continual improvement or change over time.

Better.wordDefinition:
Better refers to something that has improved or is superior to what it was before.

Better describes something that has improved, while progress describes the process of improvement.

Development.wordDefinition:
Development refers to the process of growth, improvement or advancement of something over time.

It can refer to physical, intellectual, or social growth. For instance, the development of a child involves learning to walk, talk, and read as they mature.

In simpler terms, development refers to growth over time, whereas progress refers to movement towards a goal. Development is generally applicable to individual growth or changes in a small group, while progress can be applied to societal advancements or large-scale objectives.

Enhance.wordDefinition:
Enhance means to improve or make something better. It's applicable when you want to make something that's already good, even better.

For example, you can enhance the flavors of a dish by adding more spices or improve your tennis skills by practicing more often.

Progress is about moving forward towards a specific outcome, whereas enhancement is about making something that's already there even better.

Evolution.wordDefinition:
Evolution and progress are similar concepts, but they have subtle differences. Evolution refers to a gradual and slow process of change in a particular area, such as biological species, culture, or society.

Evolution applies to natural processes that occur over long periods of time, like the development of species or cultures.

Evolution is the slow, natural process of change that happens over time, while progress is a deliberate effort to make things better.

Growth.wordDefinition:
The words growth and progress are often used interchangeably, but they have different meanings.

Growth refers to the process of increasing in size or quantity, while progress refers to the process of improving or advancing towards a goal.

For example, a plant undergoes growth as it gets taller and produces more leaves, whereas a person can make progress in their studies by learning new concepts and improving their grades.

Growth is more applicable to physical and numerical changes, while progress is more applicable to personal and societal development.

Headway.wordDefinition:
Headway and progress are both terms used to describe movement forward, but with subtle differences.

Headway refers to the progress made towards a particular goal or objective, often in the face of obstacles or challenges.

It suggests movement forward, but with a sense of struggle or difficulty. For example, "We made some headway in our project, but still have a lot of work to do.".

Headway refers to progress made in a specific context, while progress refers to a general sense of forward movement or improvement.

Improvement.wordDefinition:
Improvement refers to the process of making something better than it was before. This can be seen as a qualitative change in the way something is done, such as developing a new technique that is more efficient or effective than the old way.

Improvement is applicable in situations where we want to bring about a positive change in a particular area, such as when we aim to improve the quality of our work, the functionality of a product, or the health of our body.

Refinement.wordDefinition:
Refinement, on the other hand, typically relates to the specific improvement of something to make it more polished, elegant, or effective.

Refinement is more about improving the quality of something rather than simply moving forward or improving it in a general sense.

For example, progress could be increasing the number of schools in a community, while refinement could be improving the quality of education provided by those schools.

Progress is more about moving forward and making general improvements while refinement is about enhancing the specific qualities of something to make it better.

quotes.Text: If I can be in a place where my image is encouraging people to see different people behind the camera, and my image and the images I make can help open up a certain world view, I think that's all a part of a larger spirit of change and progress, and I'm happy to be part of it.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Ava DuVernay

quotes.Text: And I've always said, 'If two people think the same thing about everything, one of them isn't necessary.' We need to be able to understand that if we're going to make real progress.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Ben Carson

quotes.Text: People tend to think that life really does progress for everyone eventually, that people progress, but actually only some people progress. The rest of the people don't.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Alice Walker

quotes.Text: The brutalities of progress are called revolutions. When they are over we realize this: that the human race has been roughly handled, but that it has advanced.
quotes.Title: French Author
quotes.Name: Victor Hugo

quotes.Text: I feel very strongly that SpaceX would not have been able to get started, nor would we have made the progress that we have, without the help of NASA.
quotes.Title: South African Businessman
quotes.Name: Elon Musk

quotes.Text: Believe in life! Always human beings will live and progress to greater, broader, and fuller life.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: W. E. B. Du Bois

quotes.Text: Changes and progress very rarely are gifts from above. They come out of struggles from below.
quotes.Title: American Activist
quotes.Name: Noam Chomsky

quotes.Text: Life is a progress from want to want, not from enjoyment to enjoyment.
quotes.Title: English Writer
quotes.Name: Samuel Johnson

quotes.Text: The progress of the world depends almost entirely upon education.
quotes.Title: American Inventor
quotes.Name: George Eastman

quotes.Text: Life is short and progress is slow.
quotes.Title: Scientist
quotes.Name: Gabriel Lippmann
